Cooper', 'Carl Binder', 'Martin Gero']} Have watched the whole series three times now. Awesome show. Awesome show. Mr. Holmes [DVD + Digital] Ian McKellen (Actor), Laura Linney (Actor), Bill Condon (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama ["Mr. Holmes is a new twist on the world’s most famous detective. In 1947, in his remote seaside farmhouse, an aging Sherlock Holmes (Ian McKellen, Academy Award (r) nominee, 2002, Best Actor in a Supporting Role, The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring) tends to his bees, with only the company of his housekeeper (Laura Linney, Academy Award (r) nominee, 2001, Best Actress in a Leading Role, You Can Count on Me) and her charming young son, Roger. Grappling with the diminishing powers of his mind, Holmes comes to rely upon the boy as he revisits the circumstances of the unsolved case that forced him into retirement, and searches for answers to the mysteries of life and love – before it's too late."] {'Genre': 'Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Laura Linney, Bill Condon, Hiroyuki Sanada, Milo Parker, Jeffrey Hatcher, Ian McKellen, Mitch Cullin', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '35225428', 'Director': 'Bill Condon', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 10, 2015', 'Actors': 'Ian McKellen, Laura Linney, Milo Parker, Hiroyuki Sanada', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Mitch Cullin, Jeffrey Hatcher', 'Number of discs': '1'} The DVD makes is incredibly hard to start the movie, and once there, if you stop or turn of the movie for any reason, you can start it back up, either then or later, you have to go through all the 4 minutes of the DVD's "starting" garbage.

I stopped half way into it last night, had to restart, wasted half an hour with scene selection (having to go through the 4 minutes of "startup" in between each selection), the when I finally found the place, accidentally pressed stop instead of play, which reset the DVD for the 10th time. So I clicked eject. So I can't say how good the movie is but this DVD is horribly made.

My DVD player is perfectly capable of remembering where it left off other DVDs, even weeks later. The studio spent tons of money on the movie then apparently gave the DVD & its menus to be made by their unemployed nephew for $20. So I can't say how good the movie is but this DVD is HORRIBLY made. If you loved Contact, you'll definitely like this movie too. Not the same, but the same feel. Fantastic movie. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest**: The user remains engaged with science fiction television and films, particularly those blending fantasy elements with complex narratives, and they appreciate adaptations of notable literary characters that explore philosophical themes.

- **Content Preferences**: The user demonstrated openness to unexpectedly enjoying content outside their usual preferences, as shown by their recent positive review of a film that received harsh criticism elsewhere. They continue to hold high expectations for creativity and quality, expressing disappointment when standards aren’t met.

- **Format Preference**: They favor well-crafted DVD collections for their tangible quality, but frustrations with poor packaging highlight their demand for superior usability and attention to detail in product design.

- **Quality Appreciation**: The user maintains a keen awareness of production quality, as seen in their detailed ratings and criticisms. They are capable of adjusting their expectations based on surprising content, emphasizing narrative depth and overall execution.

- **Engagement with Series and Films**: Their recent purchase indicates a willingness to explore new genres and engage with different content, while also enjoying rewatching series.

- **Rating Behavior**: The user's ratings reflect a careful balance of cautious appreciation and elevate their expectations for content that surprises them positively. Their latest high rating underscores their adaptability towards media that defies initial perceptions, with a consistent focus on overall quality and engaging storytelling.
